entry.title: SAP ECC tables Vs S/4 HANA tables for SAP Migration Project
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We are migrating the SAP ECC data to S/4 HANA tables. We have a list of ECC tables identified to migrate. I would like to know the corresponding S/4 HANA tables for each ECC table. Attached the list of Unique ECC tables. Unique ECC tables list 

Could anyone help here with any document which has this information.

entry.title: Error in Transaction OAYZ ‚Äì Screen Layout Rule for Depreciation Area 01
entry.content: While executing transaction OAYZ, the system displays the following error message: ‚ÄúMaintain screen layout rule for dep.area 01 + asset class 1027 or deactivate it.‚Äù

entry.title: DRF Replication to Multiple Target Systems (F51/F52/F53) ‚Äì Feasibility Question
entry.content:
Hello,

We are going to configure DRF replication from FCW to F51 / F52 / F53 at the same time.
I would like to know if there is a way to replicate to all three systems in parallel without requiring to intervene each time to mark one system as the default port.

In other words, Is it technically possible for DRF to send the same data to multiple outbound ports simultaneously, or does DRF always require one system to be flagged as the default for each replication model?

we did a test with preproduction systems without selecting any logical ports however we see the message is failing in the source system.

NB: we used service groups so the logical ports are generated automatically.

We are in central configuration (central system is called D5W)

Regards!


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Connect MS Access to SAP SBO Hana v10 using 64bit ODBC.
entry.content:
Trying to connect MS Access to SAP SBO Hana v10 using a 64bit ODBC driver.sap s/4hana

I can create a connector and use a query to create a table in the database and the data is posted perfectly.  HOWEVER it fails ad shows be "#Deleted" in evert field when I simply create a View query.  I do not want to post most of this data, I would like viewing only.

I am new to SAP, coming from an iSeries JDE platform where this worked without issues.  And because it can create the table with the correct data, I don't quite see the issue.  (I have see where there might be interfearance because the table does not have a field that is a Primary Key)  Really do not wan't to create VIEWS for all of the tables that I would like to connect together or just show in an Access query.

The driver works fine whth Excel downloads. (This is posting data)

HDBODBC - Ver 2.07.26.35804 3/12/2021 is the one that comes close to working.  I have tried Ver 2.25.31.4803 8/12/2025 and it wil not work at all.

entry.title: Partial Billing of Service confirmation item S/4HANA On-premise 2023 FPS00
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Does System allow to do partial billing of individual Service confirmation item before the final completion mark of all items are completed ?  We're using S4/HANA On Premise 2023 FPS00.  It seems that it's supported in public cloud version, but I could not find the item category of partial billing in our version.  

Regards

Kylie

entry.title: Getting Short dump while trying to delete BIN in SAP EWM
entry.content:
Hello Team,

1. We are not able to delete Storage bin in our warehouse 0028. Storage type- LG15, Storage bin-   A-17-3-0

2. While trying to delete we are getting  ASSERTION_FAILED in short dump we can see below error.

If the error occurs in one of your own ABAP programs or an SAP program
that you have modified, try to correct the error yourself.
If the error occurs in a non-modfied SAP program, you might be able to
find a solution in the SAP Notes system. If you have access to the SAP
Notes system, check there first using the following keywords:

"ASSERTION_FAILED"
"/LIME/SAPLCORE" bzw. /LIME/LCORENOI
"SELECT_NODE"
If you cannot solve the problem yourself, please send the following
information to SAP:

1. The description of the problem (short dump)
To do this, choose  System -> List -> Save -> Local File (unconverted)
on the screen you are in now.

2. The relevant system log
To do this, call the system log in transaction SM21. Restrict the time
interval to ten minutes before the short dump and five minutes after
it. In the display, choose System -> Lis

entry.title: How to configure approval after creating invoice in S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi all,

i wonder to know how to configure approval in between 'Create incoming invoice' and 'Manage automatic payment'?

Once an invoice is created, it should be routed to an approver for approval. Only after the approver approves the invoice, the document should proceed for payment processing.

If anyone know please explain me, Thank you

entry.title: Conversion Path from ECC 6.0 EHP 8 on HANA to S/4HANA 2025 On-premise
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently evaluating our options for migrating our existing SAP ERP system to S/4HANA and would greatly appreciate some input from those with conversion experience.

Our current system landscape details are:

* **System:** SAP ERP 6.0
* **Enhancement Package:** EHP 8
* **Database:** SAP HANA

My primary technical question is:

**Is our current system (ECC 6.0 EHP 8 on SAP HANA) technically supported and compatible for a direct System Conversion (Brownfield) to the upcoming SAP S/4HANA 2025 On-premise Edition?**

---

**Context on Conversion Strategy:**

We have been speaking with our local SAP Account Executives, and they have strongly indicated that the only viable path for us moving forward is through the **RISE with SAP** offering (Cloud/Hyperscaler model).

I am specifically looking for validation regarding the *technical feasibility* of the **On-premise** conversion path. My understanding is that ECC 6.0 EHP 8 on HANA should technically be a good starting point for a direct conversion to S/4HANA On-premise.

Has anyone in the community successfully completed, or is currently planning, a conversion from this specific source release (ECC 6.0 EHP 8 on HANA) to a recent or future On-premise S/4HANA release (like 2023 or 2025)?

Thank you in advance for sharing your expertise!

entry.title: Portugal settlement document number range is not in sync with digital signature number range
entry.content:
During settlement, the sales rebate document is being created with correct sequence number as per country wise number range maintained in basic functions but the reference field in the settlement document is copying the number from digital signature number range (NR status). We have manually synced the number range of digital signature with country specific number range by changing the NR status of number range.

But whenever we are doing reversal of a settlement document, digital signature number range is not getting consumed and this is causing number mismatch between settlement document number and reference field number in the settlement document when we create the next documents.

Kindly share your inputs as i'm unable to understand what went wrong.

Settlement Management SAP S/4HANA 

@Lakshmipathi   @GauthierVictor

entry.title: Permit Change of VBEP-ETDAT for partial deliveries in sales order
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

we are using standard ATP  logic in sales orders. 

In some cases schedule line cannot be delivered completely.

System will show these information in delivered qty in tab schedule lines in sales order.

However it is possible to change the delivery date on schedule as long as VBEP-WMENG does not eq sales order qty.

This system behaviour leads to issues in evaluating delivery performance. Is their a possibility to permit these system behaviour?

 

Regards

Andreas Buchholz

entry.title: M3682 - Batch & of material & is already locked by & in MIGO
entry.content:
Dear all, 
could you please help us to solve the following problem in S4 Hana / GUI. 
Issue: We are only for displaying of a material document in MIGO / S4 (gui) and parallel at the same time we want to post a goods movement with the same material and batch by MIGO but we get the error message "M3682 - Batch & of material & is already locked by & in MIGO." The current batch seems to be blocked through the displaying mode of MIGO.
What is the reason for and what kind of customizing settings should be used in the system to be posted a goods movements by MIGO under displaying a material document by MIGO? 

Thanks in advance!

Regards,

J√°nos

entry.title: Issue in S/4HANA ‚Üí SAP Sales Cloud v2 Integration: Wrong Sender/Receiver System IDs Passed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

we are currently implementing the standard integration between SAP S/4HANA On-Premise and SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 using the official SAP Integration Suite package:

‚ÄúSAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP S/4HANA‚Äù
(in particular the iFlow ‚ÄúReplicate Sales Order and Sales Quote from SAP S/4HANA‚Äù)

During our setup we noticed a behavior that appears to be incorrect or at least not documented. The iFLow in SAP Standard expects an IDOC Structure (here message type COD_REPLICATE_SALES_ORDER)

What we observed

When S/4HANA sends sales order replication data to SAP Integration Suite, it uses the following system identifiers:

  • Sender system: S4HCLNT100

  • Receiver system: MY1001354

These are the classical Logical System names.

However, SAP Sales Cloud v2 expects the system identifiers that are defined in the Communication System setup inside Sales Cloud v2, for example:

  • Sender system: S4H_100

  • Receiver system: sap_cloud_crm_my1001354

Because of this mismatch, the standard iFlow fails unless we manually change the mapping inside the iFlow.
After adjusting the mapping, the messages are processed correctly.

Why this is confusing

In the Sales Cloud v2 integration:

  • There is no place in S/4HANA where these system IDs can be adapted specifically for Sales Cloud v2.

  • The standard content in SAP Integration Suite does not expose parameters to override sender/receiver IDs.

  • The documentation does not mention any required mapping.

This means:
The standard iFlow expects the Sales Cloud v2 Communication System IDs, but S/4HANA always sends Logical System IDs.

So the iFlow and the S/4HANA standard do not match each other out-of-the-box.

üí¨ Our question to the community

Is this behavior expected?
Or is this a gap/bug in the standard integration?

Also:
Is there any hidden configuration in S/4HANA to control which system identifiers are passed to the iFlow?
We could not find any.

At the moment, we had to modify the iFlow (which we would prefer to avoid), and we‚Äôd like to know:

  • Does SAP plan to adjust the integration content?

  • Or have other customers found a clean configuration-based solution?

Any guidance, insights, or experiences would be highly appreciated. üòä

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How to preserve remaining shelf life during post-processing batch creation in SAP?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I‚Äôm working on a project in FMCG spice manufacturing and need guidance on SAP shelf-life handling.

Problem:

  • Raw materials arrive with vendor MFG and EXP (SLED).

  • Materials may spend time in the warehouse before processing (e.g., grinding).

  • Currently, SAP sets the output batch expiry = Process Date + full shelf life, extending expiry incorrectly.

Goal:

  • Calculate output batch expiry as:
    Remaining_Life = Input_EXP minus Process_Date
    New_EXP = Process_Date plus Remaining_Life

  • Or, with fixed post-processing life:
    Candidate_EXP = Process_Date plus Fixed_PostProcess_Life
    New_EXP = the minimum of Input_EXP and Candidate_EXP

  • Earliest expiry should apply when multiple input batches are blended.

Questions:

  1. Is there a standard SAP method, BAdI, or user exit to implement this?

  2. Can it integrate with any already present logics in SAP?

Thanks for the help.

entry.title: Table that holds the text entered in tab Note for a Vendor Invoice (MIR7)
entry.content:

Please help.

Thanks!

entry.title: In public cloud how to get Sales Order Header Text
entry.content:
How can we read Sales Order Header Text in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (clean core, no modification)?

I have tried multiple ways but couldn‚Äôt get the header text of a Sales Order.
In Public Cloud:

  • Read_Text is not allowed

  • Table access to STXH/STXL is not allowed

  • CDS view extensibility for reading text via text-object/text-id is not available

  • BAdI access to SD text API is restricted

  • The only relevant released view is I_SALESORDERTP , but this cannot be used inside our custom CDS view.

entry.title: Incorrect User Lock Error
entry.content:
During the execution of the standard SAP program R\_FINS\_PLAN\_TRANS\_CO\_S4H\_2\_ERP, we encountered the following error: The report was executed by user YYYY, who is different from CCJK.
User CCJK merely launched the CJ40 transaction and is currently modifying a WBS element that is not included in the list of WBS elements belonging to the copy process. We kindly request your support to resolve this issue.  


System: PROD
Server: 10.129.15.106
Client: 300
